tit.e: Kamigamo (an area from the east side of the Kamo-gawa River to Sakyo Ward)
Kamigamo (an area from the east side of the Kamo-gawa River to Sakyo Ward)

sen.j: 上賀茂（かみがも）とは京都府京都市北区 (京都市)の賀茂川の東側から左京区にかけての地域の名称。
sen.e: Kamigamo is the area running from the eastern side of the Kamo-gawa River in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture to Sakyo Ward.
Kamigamo is the area from the eastern side of the Kamo-gawa River in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture to Sakyo Ward.
Kamigamo is the area from the eastern side of the Kamo-gawa River in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture to Sakyo Ward.

sen.j: 出町から北の神山に至る賀茂地域の北側を上賀茂、南側を下賀茂という。
sen.e: The northern part of Kamo district, from Demachi to Koyama in the north, is called Kamigamo while the southern part is called Shimogamo.
The northern part of Kamo district, from Demachi to Koyama in the north, is called Kamigamo while the southern part is called Shimogamo.
The northern part of Kamo district, from Demachi to Koyama in the north, is called Kamigamo while the southern part is called Shimogamo.

sen.j: 古くは、賀茂武角身命の一族が居住した地域である。
sen.e: It is also the area where the family of Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto lived in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also the area where the family of Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto lived in ancient times.
It is also the area where the family of Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto lived in ancient times.

sen.j: 賀茂武角身命は平安京ができる以前に山城地域を開拓した。
sen.e: It was Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto who developed the Yamashiro area prior to the establishment of Heiankyo (the ancient capital in present-day Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto who developed the Yamashiro area prior to the establishment of Heian-kyo (the ancient capital in present-day Kyoto).
It was Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto who developed the Yamashiro area prior to the establishment of Heian-kyo (the ancient capital in present-day Kyoto).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 昭和6年に京都市に編入される。
sen.e: Kamigamo was incorporated into Kyoto City in 1931.
Kamigamo was incorporated into Kyoto City in 1931.
Kamigamo was incorporated into Kyoto City in 1931.

sen.j: それ以前は、愛宕郡上賀茂村であった。
sen.e: Before that it was Kamigamo Village, Atago County.
Before that it was Kamigamo Village, Atago County.
Before that it was Kamigamo Village, Atago County.

sen.j: 長く上賀茂神社の神領として神聖な地域とされてきた。
sen.e: Kamigamo has long been considered sacred because it is made up of the estate of Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
It has long been considered as a sacred area owned by Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
It has long been considered as a sacred area owned by Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 名所
sen.e: Places of interest
Places of interest
Places of interest

sen.j: 上賀茂神社
sen.e: Kamigamo-jinja Shrine
Kamigamo-jinja Shrine
Kamigamo-jinja Shrine

sen.j: 賀茂別雷神社
sen.e: Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine
Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine
Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine

sen.j: - 上賀茂神社より古くからあったといわれている。
sen.e: Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine is thought to have been built before Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
It is thought to have been built before Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
It is thought to have been built before Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 大田の沢のカキツバタは天然記念物に指定されている。
sen.e: Rabbit Ear Iris in Ota-no-sawa swamp is designated as a Natural Monument.
Rabbit Ear Iris in Ota-no-sawa swamp is designated as a Natural Monument.
Rabbit Ear Iris in Ota-no-sawa swamp is designated as a Natural Monument.

sen.j: 北大路魯山人生誕地
sen.e: Birthplace of Rosanjin KITAOJI
Birthplace of Rosanjin KITAOJI
Birthplace of Rosanjin KITAOJI

sen.j: 大田神社の南側に石碑がある（上賀茂北大路町）。
sen.e: There is a stone monument to the south of Ota-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo Kitaoji-cho).
There is a stone monument to the south of Ota-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-Kitaoji-cho).
There is a stone monument to the south of Ota-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-Kitaoji-cho).

sen.j: 2009年3月22日 魯山人の没後50年を記念し、誕生日の前日に当たる22日に除幕式があった。
sen.e: On March 22, 2009, one day before the birth date of Rosanjin, the unveiling ceremony of this monument was held to commemorate the 50th anniversary of his death.
On March 22, 2009, one day before the birth date of Rosanjin, the unveiling ceremony of this monument was held to commemorate the 50th anniversary of his death.
On March 22, 2009, one day before the birth date of Rosanjin, the unveiling ceremony of this monument was held to commemorate the 50th anniversary of his death.

sen.j: 大田の小径
sen.e: Ota Lane
Ota no komichi Lane
Ota no komichi Lane

sen.j: - 大田神社の北側の山の尾根を歩く散策路である。
sen.e: Ota Lane is a hiking trail running along a mountain ridge to the north of Ota-jinja Shrine.
Ota no komichi Lane is a hiking trail running along a mountain ridge to the north of Ota-jinja Shrine.
Ota no komichi Lane is a hiking trail running along a mountain ridge to the north of Ota-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 深泥池
sen.e: Midoroga-ike Pond
Midoroga-ike Pond
Midoroga-ike Pond

sen.j: 賀茂季鷹歌碑
sen.e: Monument inscribed with poetry by Suetaka KAMO.
sen.cmt: 用語共有にしたがって「かものすえたか」としました。
sen.e: Monument inscribed with poetry by KAMO no Suetaka
Monument inscribed with poetry by KAMO no Suetaka

sen.j: 場所は、大田神社南交差点を南に、一筋目の道を西に入った北側の住宅（上賀茂竹ヶ鼻町）。
sen.e: This monument is located in a private residence in Kamigamo Takegahana-cho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It stands in a residence (Kamigamo-takegahara-cho) located at the northern side of the road which is to the south of Ota-jinja-minami Intersection, then to the west at the first corner.
sen.cmt: 原文の分割方法が不適切だったため、１文に戻しました。
sen.e: It stands in a residence (Kamigamo-takegahara-cho) located at the northern side of the road which is to the south of Ota-jinja-minami Intersection, then to the west at the first corner.

sen.j: 歌碑には春の吉野山を詠んだ歌が記され、下には紅葉の歌も記されている。
sen.e: A poem describing Mt. Yoshino in the springtime is inscribed on the monument, and on the lower part of the monument there is another poem about autumn leaves.
A poem describing Mt. Yoshino in the springtime is inscribed on the monument, and another poem about autumn leaves is on the lower part as well.
A poem describing Mt. Yoshino in the springtime is inscribed on the monument, and another poem about autumn leaves is on the lower part as well.

sen.j: 賀茂季鷹（かもすえたか）は、上賀茂 社家で江戸後期の歌人。
sen.e: KAMO no Suetaka was a poet who lived in the late Edo period and came from the Kamigamo Shrine "shake" (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis).
sen.cmt: 用語共有にしたがって「かものすえたか」としました。
sen.e: KAMO no Suetaka was a poet who lived in the late Edo period and came from shake (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) of the Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
KAMO no Suetaka was a poet who lived in the late Edo period and came from shake (a family of Shinto priests serving a shrine on a hereditary basis) of the Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 季鷹は、有栖川宮職仁親王に手ほどきを受けた後、江戸にて文人墨客と交わった。
sen.e: Suetaka learnt poetry from Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito and moved to Edo to be with other artists.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Suetaka learnt poetry from Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito and moved to Edo to be with other writers and artists.
Suetaka learnt poetry from Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito and moved to Edo to be with other writers and artists.

sen.j: 京に帰った後は上賀茂神社で神職となり、「雲錦亭」と名付けた文化サロンを主宰した。
sen.e: He then returned to Kyoto to become a priest in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and organized a cultural salon named "Unkintei."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He then returned to Kyoto to become a priest in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and organized a cultural salon named 'Unkintei.'
He then returned to Kyoto to become a priest in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and organized a cultural salon named 'Unkintei.'

sen.j: 京都市伝統的建造物群保存地区
sen.e: Kyoto City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Buildings
Kyoto City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Buildings
Kyoto City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Buildings

sen.j: 京都の特色ある歴史的な町並みの整備を行う区域。
sen.e: Kyoto City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Buildings is an area where the historical cityscape characteristic of Kyoto is preserved.
Kyoto City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Buildings is an area where the historical cityscape characteristic of Kyoto is preserved.
Kyoto City Preservation District for Groups of Historic Buildings is an area where the historical cityscape characteristic of Kyoto is preserved.

sen.j: 産寧坂地区、祇園新橋地区、嵯峨鳥居本地区と上賀茂地区が指定されている。
sen.e: Sannei-zaka district, Gionshinbashi district, Saga Toriimoto district and Kamigamo district have been designated as the preservation district.
Sannei-zaka district, Gionshinbashi district, Saga Toriimoto district and Kamigamo district have been designated as the preservation district.
Sannei-zaka district, Gionshinbashi district, Saga Toriimoto district and Kamigamo district have been designated as the preservation district.

sen.j: この４地区については、国の重要伝統的建造物群保存地区の選定を受けている。
sen.e: These four districts are also designated as National Preservation Districts for Important Traditional Buildings.
sen.cmt: 重要伝統的建造物群保存地区は「用語共有」では、Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildingsとなっていますが、京都市伝統的建造物群保存地区との区別が出来ないため、訳し分けました。
sen.e: These four districts are also designated as National Preservation Districts for Important Traditional Buildings.
These four districts are also designated as National Preservation Districts for Important Traditional Buildings.

sen.j: 名物
sen.e: Local specialty
Local specialty
Local specialty

sen.j: すぐき漬
sen.e: Suguki-zuke
Suguki-zuke
Suguki-zuke

sen.j: - 京野菜のすぐき菜の漬物である。
sen.e: Suguki-zuke is a kind of pickled vegetable found in Kyoto made from Suguki leaves.
Suguki-zuke is a kind of pickled vegetable found in Kyoto made from Suguki leaves.
Suguki-zuke is a kind of pickled vegetable found in Kyoto made from Suguki leaves.

sen.j: 賀茂茄子
sen.e: Kamonasu
Kamonasu
Kamonasu

sen.j: - 賀茂茄子（かもなす）は、京野菜で、丸くて大きなナスである。
sen.e: Kamonasu is a large round eggplant indigenous to Kyoto ('Kyo-yasai' vegetable).
Kamonasu is a large round eggplant of Kyo-yasai (vegetable indigenous to Kyoto).
Kamonasu is a large round eggplant of Kyo-yasai (vegetable indigenous to Kyoto).

sen.j: やきもち
sen.e: Yakimochi cake
Yakimochi (fried rice cake)
Yakimochi (fried rice cake)

sen.j: - 上賀茂神社のバス停近くの神馬堂と葵屋で販売されている。
sen.e: This cake is sold in Jinbado and Aoiya, located near Kamigamo-jinja Shrine bus stop.
This rice cake is sold at Jinbado and Aoiya store, located near Kamigamo-jinja Shrine bus stop.
This rice cake is sold at Jinbado and Aoiya store, located near Kamigamo-jinja Shrine bus stop.

sen.j: 祭
sen.e: Festival
Festival
Festival

sen.j: 葵祭（あおいまつり）
sen.e: Aoi-matsuri Festival
Aoi-matsuri Festival
Aoi-matsuri Festival

sen.j: 幸在祭（さんやれさい）
sen.e: Sanyare-sai Festival
Sanyare-sai Festival
Sanyare-sai Festival

sen.j: 「山野礼祭」とも書く。
sen.e: Sanyare-sai Festival can also be spelled as 山野礼祭 using different characters.
Sanyare-sai Festival (幸在祭) can also be written as 山野礼祭 using different characters.
Sanyare-sai Festival (幸在祭) can also be written as 山野礼祭 using different characters.

sen.j: 毎年2月24日に行われる。
sen.e: The festival is held annually on February 24.
The festival is held annually on February 24.
The festival is held annually on February 24.

sen.j: 古来より数え年十五才をむかえた男の子の元服の祭りであると言われている。
sen.e: It is believed to be a festival celebrating the coming of age for boys who have turned 15 as calculated by the traditional Japanese system from ancient times.
From ancient time, it is believed to be a festival celebrating the coming of age for boys at the age of 15 in the traditional way of counting age.
From ancient time, it is believed to be a festival celebrating the coming of age for boys at the age of 15 in the traditional way of counting age.

sen.j: 行列に参加する年齢はその年に生まれた赤ちゃんから数え年十五歳まで。
sen.e: The ceremonial processions are made up of children aged from zero (born in that year) to 15 years old as calculated using this system.
The ceremonial processions are made up of children from babies born in that year to boys at the age of 15 in the traditional way of counting age.
The ceremonial processions are made up of children from babies born in that year to boys at the age of 15 in the traditional way of counting age.

sen.j: 祭り行列は、一町内ごとになっていて、先頭から、木を持つ子ども、鐘を鳴らす子ども、太鼓を叩く子どもの順に並ぶ。
sen.e: The ceremonial processions are organized town by town, and each procession is led by a child holding a wooden bar followed by a child ringing a bell and then a child beating a drum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ceremonial processions are organized by each town, and is led by a child holding a wooden bar followed by a child ringing a bell and then a child beating a drum.
The ceremonial processions are organized by each town, and is led by a child holding a wooden bar followed by a child ringing a bell and then a child beating a drum.

sen.j: 数え年十五才を迎えた男の子は「アガリ」と称し、「アガリ」の子は、祭り行列の後方に位置し太鼓を叩く。
sen.e: Boys who have become 15 years old by the traditional Japanese system are called "agari" and stand at the back of the procession and beat a drum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Boys at the age of 15 in the traditional way of counting age are called 'agari' who stand at the back of the procession and beat a drum.
Boys at the age of 15 in the traditional way of counting age are called 'agari' who stand at the back of the procession and beat a drum.

sen.j: その服装は大島紬の着物に羽織、首には白絹のマフラーをかけ、白足袋に桐の下駄をはく。
sen.e: The agari boys wear a kimono, a haori half coat of oshima-tsumugi (a kimono fabric woven from colored threads which originated in Amami-Oshima, south of Kyushu), a white silk scarf around their neck, white "tabi" socks, and "geta" shoes made of Paulownia wood.

The agari boys wear a kimono of oshima-tsumugi (a kimono fabric woven from colored threads which originated in Amami-Oshima, south of Kyushu), a haori half coat, a white silk scarf around their neck, shirotabi (white Japanese socks), and geta (Japanese footwear, wooden clogs) made of Paulownia wood.

The agari boys wear a kimono of oshima-tsumugi (a kimono fabric woven from colored threads which originated in Amami-Oshima, south of Kyushu), a haori half coat, a white silk scarf around their neck, shirotabi (white Japanese socks), and geta (Japanese footwear, wooden clogs) made of Paulownia wood.

sen.j: 烏相撲（からすずもう）
sen.e: Karasu-zumo
Karasu-zumo (literally, Crow Sumo, a wrestling ceremony)
Karasu-zumo (literally, Crow Sumo, a wrestling ceremony)

sen.j: 毎年9月9日に行われる。
sen.e: Karasu-zumo is held annually on September 9.
Karasu-zumo is held annually on September 9.
Karasu-zumo is held annually on September 9.

sen.j: 上賀茂神社の祭神である賀茂別雷命の祖父にあたる賀茂武角身命が、神武天皇の東征のときにヤタガラスとなって導いたことに由来する。
sen.e: Kamowakeikazuchi no mikoto, whose grandfather was Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto, is worshipped in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It originates that Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto, who was a grandfather of Kamowakeikazuchi no mikoto enshrined in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, transformed into a sacred crow to lead Emperor Jinmu on a campaign of his great Eastern Expedition.
sen.cmt: 原文の分割方法が不適切だったため、１文に戻し、訳文修正しました。
sen.e: It originates that Kamotaketsunomi no mikoto, who was a grandfather of Kamowakeikazuchi no mikoto enshrined in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, transformed into a sacred crow to lead Emperor Jinmu on a campaign of his great Eastern Expedition.

sen.j: 小学生の相撲である。
sen.e: It is a sumo performance staged by elementary school children.
It is a sumo performance by elementary school children.
It is a sumo performance by elementary school children.

sen.j: 地域活動
sen.e: Community activities
Community activities
Community activities

sen.j: 葵プロジェクト
sen.e: Afuhi Project
Afuhi Project (also referred as Aoi Project)
sen.cmt: 「葵プロジェクト」のウェブサイトの表記を採用し、一般的な読みを補足しました。http://www.afuhi.jp/about/
sen.e: Afuhi Project (also referred as Aoi Project)

sen.j: 上賀茂神社の葵を増やすために地域が協力して葵を植えている。
sen.e: The community works together and plants hollyhocks to increase their number in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
The community works together and plants aoi (hollyhocks) to increase their number in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
The community works together and plants aoi (hollyhocks) to increase their number in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 上賀茂小学校では、小学校で育てた葵を上賀茂神社に植え替えている。
sen.e: Hollyhocks are first grown in Kamigamo Elementary School and then replanted in Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kamigamo Elementary School replanted hollyhocks they grow to Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.
Kamigamo Elementary School replanted hollyhocks they grow to Kamigamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 育てられた葵は、葵祭でも使用されている。
sen.e: Some of these hollyhocks are then used for the Aoi-matsuri Festival.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some of these hollyhocks are also used for the Aoi-matsuri Festival.
Some of these hollyhocks are also used for the Aoi-matsuri Festival.

sen.j: 上賀茂スクールガード隊
sen.e: Kamigamo School Guard Team
Kamigamo School Guard Team
Kamigamo School Guard Team

sen.j: 上賀茂地域では、自治連合会が中心になり、各種団体の協力のもと、ボランティアの隊員によるスクールガード隊を組織し、登下校時を中心に子どもたちの安全を見守っている。
sen.e: In Kamigamo region a group of resident associations, with support from various other groups, plays a central role in organizing a school protection team made up of volunteers to help safeguard children, especially on their way between school and home.

In Kamigamo region, a school guard team is volunteered to be organized, supported by various groups centered in a residents' joint association, to watch the children, especially commuting to and from school and home safely.

In Kamigamo region, a school guard team is volunteered to be organized, supported by various groups centered in a residents' joint association, to watch the children, especially commuting to and from school and home safely.

sen.j: 上賀茂小学校・上賀茂幼稚園・上賀茂保育園・上賀茂児童館および各保護者会が協力し防犯等の連絡を取り合っている。
sen.e: Kamigamo Elementary School, Kamigamo Kindergarten, Kamigamo Nursery School, Kamigamo Children's Center and their parents associations work together and coordinate their efforts in areas such as security.
Kamigamo Elementary School, Kamigamo Kindergarten, Kamigamo Nursery School, Kamigamo Children's Center and each parents' associations work together to communicate about security, and so on.
Kamigamo Elementary School, Kamigamo Kindergarten, Kamigamo Nursery School, Kamigamo Children's Center and each parents' associations work together to communicate about security, and so on.

sen.j: 自転車ヘルメット着用推進地域
sen.e: Region promoting the use of cycling helmets
Region promoting the use of cycling helmets
Region promoting the use of cycling helmets

sen.j: 上賀茂小学校・上賀茂幼稚園・上賀茂保育園および各保護者会が協力して自転車用のヘルメットの着用に向けて努力中。
sen.e: Kamigamo Elementary School, Kamigamo Kindergarten, Kamigamo Nursery School and their parents associations cooperate to encourage the use of cycling helmets.
Kamigamo Elementary School, Kamigamo Kindergarten, Kamigamo Nursery School and each parents' associations cooperate to encourage the use of cycling helmets.
Kamigamo Elementary School, Kamigamo Kindergarten, Kamigamo Nursery School and each parents' associations cooperate to encourage the use of cycling helmets.

sen.j: 2008年 上賀茂小学校は、交通安全協会より自転車ヘルメット着用推進校の指定を受けた。
sen.e: In 2008 Kamigamo Elementary School was recognized by the Traffic Safety Association for its efforts to promote the use of helmets while cycling.
In 2008 Kamigamo Elementary School was designated as a school of promoting the use of helmets while cycling by the Traffic Safety Association.
In 2008 Kamigamo Elementary School was designated as a school of promoting the use of helmets while cycling by the Traffic Safety Association.
